Key Match Events: Giancarlo Stanton smashed a clutch home run in the eighth inning to secure the win.
Kris Bubic's mistake on a 3-1 pitch allowed Giancarlo Stanton to launch a game-changing home run.
Luke Weaver calmly navigated a bases-loaded situation to secure the save.
Pre-Game Insights: The game marked a historic occasion, as it was the first postseason contest at Kauffman Stadium in over 3,000 days.
Despite facing challenges against Seth Lugo’s diverse pitch mix, the Yankees’ offensive efforts eventually paid off.
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Judge’s offensive struggles continued, as he went 0 for 4 with a walk.
The Yankees’ patience at the plate, evident in their 22 walks throughout the series, played a significant role in their success.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Royals legend Eric Hosmer threw out the ceremonial first pitch.
Juan Soto narrowly missed a home run that would have cleared the fence in 17 other ballparks.
The Yankees’ bullpen’s dominance was a key factor in their victory.
